senses.de: Something bought or offered for sale at a lower than usual price.
senses.ex: I got these shoes on sale, they were a real bargain.

Tips.title: Shopping Context
Tips.description: Use 'bargain' when discussing shopping deals or sales.
Tips.example: This jacket is only $20, such a bargain!

Tips.title: Emotional Implication
Tips.example: I felt proud for snagging that dress at a bargain.

senses.de: To negotiate or argue for a better price or terms.
senses.ex: He bargained with the seller to reduce the price.

Tips.title: Negotiation Strategy
Tips.description: As a verb, 'bargain' implies a strategic discussion on price.
Tips.example: I bargained hard and got the table at half price.

Tips.title: Skilled Persuasion
Tips.description: 'Bargaining' shows skill in persuading someone to lower prices.
Tips.example: She's good at bargaining at yard sales.

senses.de: An agreement between two or more parties about what each will do for the other.
senses.ex: They made a bargain to share the cost of dinner.

Tips.title: Formal Agreements
Tips.description: Use 'bargain' for formal or legal agreements beyond shopping.
Tips.example: They struck a bargain that ended the dispute.

Tips.title: Mutual Promises
Tips.example: The employee's bargain included a non-compete clause.

senses.de: Being sold at a discounted or lower than usual price.
senses.ex: This is a bargain product, so it's cheaper than usual.

Tips.title: Inexpensive Quality
Tips.description: Bargain products may be cheap, but not necessarily low quality.
Tips.example: This phone is discounted and a real bargain!

Tips.title: Advertising Appeal
Tips.description: 'Bargain' can attract buyers looking for a good deal.
Tips.example: Our store advertises bargain furniture every August.

senses.de: 'Into the bargain' is a phrase meaning 'in addition to other things'.
senses.ex: He cooked dinner and did the dishes into the bargain.

Tips.title: Extra Advantages
Tips.description: The phrase 'into the bargain' highlights unexpected benefits.
Tips.example: He threw in free delivery into the bargain.

Tips.title: Enhanced Offer
Tips.description: Use 'into the bargain' to emphasize an enhanced deal.
Tips.example: The car comes with a sunroof into the bargain.

Agreement.wordDefinition:
An agreement is when two or more parties come to a mutual understanding or decision on something, either verbally or in writing.

Agreement can be applicable in situations like two parties signing a contract or agreeing to terms for a business partnership, while a bargain is applicable in situations when purchasing goods, bargaining for the price of services or negotiating wages of an employee.

An agreement is a broader term used for formal, legal, and mutual understanding between two or more parties, while a bargain is a term used for a negotiation on a purchase or exchange.

Arrangement.wordDefinition:
Arrangement refers to a plan or agreement made between two or more parties to achieve a specific goal or outcome.

Arrangements are usually more formal and involve a detailed plan or agreement.

In summary, arrangements involve making plans or agreements, while bargains involve negotiating prices or exchanging goods or services.

Compromise.wordDefinition:
Compromise refers to finding a middle ground in a situation where two parties have different opinions or demands.

For example, if you and your friend want to watch different movies, you could compromise by agreeing to watch a movie that you both haven't seen before.

In short, bargaining is used when two parties want to come to an agreement on a price, while compromising is used when two parties want to find a solution to a disagreement or conflict.

Contract.wordDefinition:
A contract is a legally binding agreement between two or more parties that sets out the terms and conditions of a transaction or relationship.

It is typically in writing and signed by all parties involved. For example, an employment contract outlines the specific terms and expectations of an employee's job.

A bargain is a casual agreement on the terms of something, while a contract is a formal, legal agreement that outlines the specific terms and conditions of a transaction or relationship.

Deal.wordDefinition:
A deal refers to an agreement made between two parties to exchange goods or services at a mutually agreed-upon price.

For example, if you buy a new laptop for $500 when its actual value is $800, you got a bargain. If you agree to mow your neighbor's lawn for $20, that's a deal.

Both words can be used interchangeably in some contexts, but generally, bargain is used for purchasing items or getting a good price, while deal is used for negotiations, agreements, or exchanges.

Pact.wordDefinition:
A pact is a formal agreement between two parties, usually with a more significant impact or consequence. It usually involves promises or commitments to one another and may relate to personal, professional, or political matters.

A bargain refers to a negotiation for a specific exchange of goods, services or money, while a pact is a formal agreement between two parties that may involve promises or commitments.

Settlement.wordDefinition:
A settlement is an agreement between parties to end a dispute or conflict by making concessions or compromises. It is applicable in legal or diplomatic situations where there is a conflict, such as a lawsuit or international conflict, and a mutually agreeable conclusion needs to be reached.

A bargain involves negotiating a price, while a settlement involves resolving a conflict through concessions and compromises.

Transaction.wordDefinition:
A transaction refers to any exchange of goods or services between two or more parties.

A bargain refers to a specific type of transaction where the price is negotiated to reach a favorable deal, while a transaction is a broader term that encompasses all types of exchanges between parties.

Bargain is applicable when someone is trying to get a good deal or negotiate a price, while transaction is applicable whenever there is an exchange of goods or services between two or more parties.

quotes.Text: Work is important, no doubt, but one can end up neglecting family and friends in the bargain. So I have resolved not to let that happen and maintain work-life balance by taking time out for the people who matter the most to me.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Disha Patani

quotes.Text: I think one of the most important facts of basic income would be that it's not only a redistribution of income, but also of power. So the cleaners and bin men would have a lot more bargaining power.
quotes.Title: Dutch Historian
quotes.Name: Rutger Bregman

quotes.Text: If we ever hope to rid the world of the political AIDS of our time, terrorism, the rule must be clear: One does not deal with terrorists; one does not bargain with terrorists; one kills terrorists.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Meir Kahane

quotes.Text: Many people do not realize that where unions have bargaining rights employers cannot raise wages or improve benefit plans any more than they can reduce them without of the consent of the union.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Charles E. Wilson

quotes.Text: I went into 'Bigg Boss' because I wanted to experience what it was like. It was more disorienting than I had bargained for. I began to forget the names of people in my life. It got scary.

quotes.Name: Hiten Tejwani

quotes.Text: Where laws recognize rights to collective bargaining, the truth is that employee rights to negotiate with employers are denied in many countries.
quotes.Title: Welsh Activist
quotes.Name: Sharan Burrow

quotes.Text: I will continue to do all that I can to ensure and enhance worker protections, including the right to bargain collectively.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jan Schakowsky

quotes.Text: My mother raised us to think that if we worked hard, and if we put our end of the bargain in, it would work out OK for us.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Ursula Burns

quotes.Text: Battles, unlike bargains, are rarely discussed in society.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: James Fenimore Cooper
